name: Palmate-bracted Bird's-beak
text:
Keep a look out for any of these species!

This plant is charecterized by being openly branched and spindly. The flowers are yellow or dull purplish bilaterally symmetrical, resembleing a birds beak. The flowers cluster towards the ends of the branches, usaually at 2 to 3.1 centimeters in length. Outer bracts around around the flowers have up to 7 very slender lobes. The leaves are generally diveded into 3 to 5 segments at lengths of 2.5 to 5 centimeters.
